level.heading: Purposes.
level.text: In enacting this subchapter, the Council of the District of Columbia supports the following statutory purposes:
To authorize the establishment of a public school of law for the District of Columbia; and

To ensure that the programs and clinical operations of the School of Law of Antioch University, in operation as of February 24, 1987, are adopted initially as the programs and clinical operations of the public School of Law for the District of Columbia.

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary amendment of section, see § 2(a) of the Public School of Law Amendment Emergency Act of 1990 (D.C. Act 8-151, January 26, 1990, 37 DCR 1060).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 6-177
level.text: Law 6-177, "Authorization for the Establishment of a Public School of Law for the District of Columbia Amendment Act of 1986," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-472, which was referred to the Committee on Education. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 23, 1986, and October 7, 1986, respectively. Approved without the signature of the Mayor on October 31, 1986, it was assigned Act No. 6-227 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 8-74
level.text: Law 8-74 was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-356, which was referred to the Committee on Education and Libraries. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 24, 1989, and November 7, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on November 16, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-114 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
